prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText: Our required 1 sigma sensitivity of optical depth is 0.02, which corresponds to HCO+ column density of 6.6x10^10 cm-2 for a velocity FWHM of 2 km/s. The corresponding H2 column density will he twenty times less than that CO emission starts to turn on, so it gives a good probe of H2 without CO. The spectral line is expected to have an optical depth of 0.1. As that example shown in our scientific justification, absorption line has a width of about 2 km/s. Colder clouds with smaller velocity width is expected. Thus velocity resolution of 0.2 km/s is chosen. A bandwidth of about 200 km/s is chosen as galactic cloud can reach a velocity of 100 km/s.

Our major purpose is to investigate CO dark molecular gas through absorption lines towards continuum sources. The absorption lines may caused by cold molecular gas and are expected to have narrow line width (<2 km/s). We take a velocity resolution of 0.2 km/s to ensure detection for even narrower lines. The correlators are arranged in the standards manner.

Our targets are strong compact continuum sources. Angular resolution is not so important to us as we focus on spectra observation. Thus,largest angular scale is chosen as 10 arcsec with angular resolution of 3 arcsec.

Our major purpose is to investigate CO dark molecular gas through absorption lines towards continuum sources. The velocity resolution and bandwith chosen are necessary to achieve our science goals. Their setting are justified in above sections. Basebands containning HCN (F=1-1, 2-1 and 1-0) and HNC (F=1-0) hyperfine transitions are included in this band and result in high data rate. However, these additional lines will improve the scientific return of the project.

Our required 1 sigma sensitivity of optical depth is 0.02, which corresponds to HCO+ column density of 6.6x10^10 cm-2 for a velocity FWHM of 2 km/s. The corresponding H2 column density will he twenty times less than that CO emission starts to turn on, so it gives a good probe of H2 without CO. The spectral line is expected to have an optical depth of 0.1. As that example shown in our scientific justification, absorption line has a width of about 2 km/s. Colder clouds with smaller velocity width is expected. Thus velocity resolution of 0.2 km/s is chosen. A bandwidth of about 200 km/s is chosen as galactic cloud can reach a velocity of 100 km/s.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract: The common, familiar tracer for molecular hydrogen (H2) is CO emission. However, H2 without CO emission, called "Dark Molecular Gas", turns out to be surprisingly abundant, roughly equal in mass to the more familiar CO-traced H2. Dark Molecular Gas represents the transition between the atomic ISM to the molecule-dominated ISM -- the initial stage of star formation, which lies at the very heart of modern astrophysics. To explore the conditions that lead to this transition, we propose a broad frontal attack on Dark molecular gas, consisting of (1) using ALMA to measure the lowest three rotational lines of HCO+ and CO in absorption against the strong mm-wave continuum source 3C454.3; (2) using ALMA to survey the J=1-0 lines of HCO+ and CO and HCN, HNC, and CN lines against 12 strong mm-wave continuum sources. In absorption, ALMA can accomplish in minutes what requires hours at CARMA, making such a systematic study feasible.
